options.text: Breathing exercises, meditation, and spiritual contemplation

options.text: Reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety disorders

title: Can steroids save your life? - Anees Bahji

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason steroids have different effects on the body?

options.label: B
options.text: Steroids have different side chains that impact their function.

options.label: C
options.text: Steroids refer to substances with shared effects on the body.

options.label: D
options.text: Steroids refer to substances with a shared molecular structure.

multiple-choice.question: What is the molecular structure that all steroids have in common?

options.label: A
options.text: A base of three hexagons and one pentagon made of 16 carbon atoms.

options.label: B
options.text: A base of four rings made of 17 carbon atoms arranged in three hexagons and one pentagon.

options.label: C
options.text: A base of five hexagons made of 20 carbon atoms.

options.label: D
options.text: A base of two pentagons made of 15 carbon atoms.

multiple-choice.question: Why are steroids able to cross fatty cell membranes and enter cells?

options.label: B
options.text: Steroids are made of fatty molecules like cholesterol.

options.label: D
options.text: Steroids are made of nucleic acids.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the naturally occurring steroid that anti-inflammatory medications are based on?
What is cortisol's primary function in the body?

options.label: C
options.text: To act as the body's primary stress signal

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of cortisol suppressing the immune system's ability to produce inflammation?
Why do medicinal corticosteroids channel cortisol's effects on the immune system?

options.label: B
options.text: To fight allergic reactions, rashes, and asthma

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between inhaled or topical corticosteroids and intravenous or oral corticosteroids?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhaled or topical corticosteroids have a faster effect.

options.label: B
options.text: Intravenous or oral corticosteroids have a faster effect.

options.label: C
options.text: Inhaled or topical corticosteroids impact only the affected organ, while intravenous or oral corticosteroids impact the whole body.

options.label: D
options.text: Inhaled or topical corticosteroids impact the whole body, while intravenous or oral corticosteroids impact only the affected organ.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using a constant low dose of steroids to treat chronic autoimmune conditions?

options.label: C
options.text: To keep the renegade immune response under control

multiple-choice.question: What is the common factor among conditions such as asthma, poison ivy welts, and irritable bowel syndrome?

options.label: B
options.text: An immune response that's doing more harm than good

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about axolotls among salamanders?

options.text: They can only regenerate their spinal cord.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: To study the spread of cancer cells.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about axolotls' body parts?

options.label: C
options.text: They can be transplanted from one axolotl to another.

options.text: Scientists were able to successfully transplant an axolotl head onto the back of another axolotl.

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: I Like Myself - Children's books read aloud

title: Why do these deadly insects look like flowers?

options.label: C
options.text: By looking bigger and brighter than flowers to pollinators

options.text: By mimicking the scent of flowers

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.text: To explain the difference between "there", "their", and "they're"
